answers.answer: Any good Diabetes Magazines would be helpful also?
Ohhh...actually it would be great if someone new about any good Diabetes Magazines or Cookbooks?

For ideas go to:http://www.atkins.com/Recipes.aspxhttp://www.diabetes.org/food-and-fitness/?loc=GlobalNavFFAvoid foods made with white flour [breads, crackers], starchy foods like white rice and potatoes, pasta [Dreamfields brand has only 5% digestible carbs], as these elevate blood sugars rapidly. Instead, eat whole grains, vegetables, fish, lean poultry [remove the skin] and lean meats. Eat fruits with other foods to slow the absorption of fructose [fruit sugar]. Understand the difference between Simple and Complex carbs. Although carbs elevate blood sugars your body needs carbs for energy. Going to low can create health issues besides making your sweat smell like ammonia. Good luck -
If anyone else has any good ideas please let me know.

Check out the website DiabeticLiving.com; it is excellent! Lots of good ideas for recipes that are absolutely delicious. Plus articles on PWD's (People with Diabetes) and exercise and nutrition. I love it!
DiabeticLiving.com is a really good website.

question: Does anyone know any good recipes for someone with Type II Diabetes?
title: Good Recipes
